website_summaries.verdict: Good quality for a disposable coverall that is sized to fit taller people.
pros: Drawstring hood helps to protect your head
Includes attached boots to help protect your footwear
Elastic on the hood helps to frame your face opening for better movement
Zippers and elastics work well and hold up to movement while you are working
Seams do not have a problem splitting
cons: While these suits can repel water, they are not waterproof

customer_reviews.title: Works great but you will likely overheat in it
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'-9", 150lbs, and the large size fit just right. I used this for a DIY spray foam kit and it held up well during the whole job. I would highly recommend going with a more breathable coverall if you are not trying to protect yourself from liquids or hazardous chemicals. Tyvek while great for liquid resistance has too low of a vapor permeability to be comfortable working in for me. For what I used it for all I needed was contact protection to prevent the spray foam from contacting my skin or clothes. Next time I will try something like DuPont ProShield coveralls.
customer_reviews.author: Luke S

customer_reviews.title: Great product, size up.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these when we were having foundation work done to crawl under house. I’m 5’8, so I ordered the large based on other reviews. They fit perfectly. I loved the attached shoe cover/bootie, because I don’t have a pair of work boots that I’d want to ruin. After about 30 minutes, I probably lost 4 lbs in sweat, but it’s the summer, and the suit is designed to not let anything in (or out :-). If you don’t encounter any snags, they are great for multiple crawls.
customer_reviews.author: PeanutMommy

customer_reviews.title: Tears and falls apart
customer_reviews.text: I have the correct size on - XL for 5'10", 195, athletic build and they RIP in the crotch and down the leg every time within a an hour of demo time. These are SO TERRIBLE that I wouldn't even reccomend you buying this as a Halloween costume to make you even LOOK LIKE you are working on something!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: It'll rid off after two weeks of constant usage on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.text: Protective coverall will rip off after two weeks of constant wear on it. Basically like one of the reviewer please get one size up even though it will feel loose. I got medium and it was comfort fit, but bottom area start to rip after the first week wearing it and the second week it the waist area start to tear apart. I would suggest getting one size up because of the tear and ripping. Beside that it does feel hot inside with two layers. Just wear your tantop over the coverall then you'll feel more cooler. And the hood I think is too big for my head and doesn't fit comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a dirty job
customer_reviews.text: I had the dirtiest of jobs; an overflow on my sewer line under the porch. With this, plus a pair of waterproof gloves and face mask, the job was practically bearable. When done, just peel off and throw away Note; these are clearly marked disposable. They are not meant to be washable, and will get small rips if you brush against rough masonry. They still get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: bridgecross

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and value
customer_reviews.text: The Tyvek brand suits are better than the alternatives I've tried. I tend to split the seams of lower quality coveralls, but haven't had a problem with these. When just using these to contain messes (rather than fiberglass, lead, or other hazardous material), I can get away with throwing them in the washing machine and reusing them. I have gotten a couple with broken zippers. Not happy about that, but I taped them shut and they worked alright. Now, if they could make it so they weren't incredibly hot to wear, I'd never try anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Donated to local hospitals
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for China but the Corora Virus ended in China fast. End up donating to the local hospital after Corona Virus outbreak in USA. The nurses like them
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: DuPont Tyvek TY122S Disposable Coveralls with Hood and Boots highly effective
customer_reviews.text: The disposable coveralls were well designed and easy to get on and off. The boots were attached to the coverall legs making taping unnecessary. Elastic at the cuffs and face made for a very good seal around the full face respirator. After a full day of work there was no detectable infiltration of insulation into the suit or onto my clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting that "dirty job" done!
customer_reviews.text: I love this suit!! Before I bought this item I read a lot of reviews and did quite a bit of research. The item came on time and was well packaged. The suit fits perfectly but mainly because I bought it one size bigger than I usually buy. I'm an XL and I bought the 2X because in reading other reviews it seemed that most people felt the sizing was just a little small. I don't think that's accurate, but just to be safe, buy one size larger than you usually buy. It'll fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: RuffWater1

customer_reviews.title: Outerwear, Tyvek, DuPont Tyvek, biolotical hazard protection, coveralls
customer_reviews.text: Every one needs a couple of these protective suits available. At a minimum, they keep you clean from head to toe, since they cover your footwear. Only a mask is needed. I use for working in water or dust, whenever on disaster assignments. But good for working in wet, cold weather...large enough to fit over your regular clothing for most people. They used these for Ebola protection in W Africa, by several civilian and military operations.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Whitlock

customer_reviews.title: Everything sticks to it
customer_reviews.text: Good quality suit. Holds up better than Menards suits. However the fuzzy side of the tyvek is out. First time in the attic with it I looked like a ball of cellulose and fiberglass in 5 minutes. Everything stuck to it. Then you have to track all that in the house. I wear them inside out now. Bad design. I'd make with shiny side out and add a little grip layer onto the feet. Would be a way better suit.
customer_reviews.author: EdStein

customer_reviews.title: Just the thing for painting and random dirty jobs, plus if Ebola hits you'll already have ...
customer_reviews.text: Just the thing for painting and random dirty jobs, plus if Ebola hits you'll already have an outfit ready. Who doesn't need a pack of these? I'm 6' 160 and the XL fits perfect, but go bigger if you're bigger. Edit to add- consider ripping off the booties at the seam if you don't really need them. They're slicker than s#it and will get you killed... Be aware that these suits don't breathe, and can be a sauna if worn for long. Suit up, get er done, and shower...
customer_reviews.author: isiton?

customer_reviews.title: quality item as described
customer_reviews.text: I use these for crawlspace work for my cable company because the cloth suits they provide don't work well. the zippers bust and they get gross when i have to go through wet dirt plus I have to clean them in my own washing machine so i prefer to just buy these and toss them after a use or two. This size XXL I think it is fits me good i'm 5'6" and 230 pounds. Don't expect to get this over your work boots though. I just take my boots off then put them back on over the suit.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good protective gear
customer_reviews.text: Great suit, wore it in crawlspace and was nice not to worry about pests running up my pants legs. There is little information about sizing on Amazon. I'm about 5'10" and 190 lbs and the XL is big but not too clumsy. I could have probably gone down one size but it doesn't matter. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tractor Tech

customer_reviews.title: A solid buy
customer_reviews.text: Great jumpsuit. My only complaint is obviously how hot it gets when wearing this. If you live up north, I'd recommend using this in the winter. I generally get warm anyway, but I was outside in just a tee shirt and shorts (while wearing this) and was comfortable in the snow. If you plan on wearing goggles, invest in some good anti-fog ones because you'll be sweating a lot. Other than the temperature, it's a great product. Was able to crawl around in a crawl space for multiple projects before I actually had to throw it out. It would tear against screws and sharp things, but pretty resistant considering how thin it is.
customer_reviews.author: WES

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't wear it to a party
customer_reviews.text: Had to go in the attic. It fit and kept the fiberglass off me and my clothing. I did sweat but it breathed very well.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: and tear easily. Not sure if I like the attached booties
customer_reviews.text: These do the job of full coverage. They are a thin, paper-like material, and tear easily. Not sure if I like the attached booties, we had to cut the toe off so my husband could fit them into his boots. Could be a little roomier, my husband is 6ft and about 240 pds. This was a little snug for him height-wise. Excellent price for this, we paid about $5 for each suit.
customer_reviews.author: Buckeyeproud

customer_reviews.title: Good protection in dusty environments
customer_reviews.text: I needed these for a project inside a uranium mine. Keep as much dust off our bodies and clothing was essential and these worked great. They weren't excessively hot and seemed to breath well. The size was perfect as well.
customer_reviews.author: OpenTrackRacer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t feel nasty anymore after sprays
customer_reviews.text: Nothing goes through when spraying until you rip it by accident somehow. Like a sauna suit and I love it since I know I’m protected
customer_reviews.author: Jae A.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to keep me fiberglass-free because I am rebuilding my kitchen. They work perfectly. The only caveat is the attached 'footsies' are a little too small for my (very large) feet. I cannot wear work boots with the coverall on, I have to wear training shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable Protection
customer_reviews.text: Two of us used a pack of 6 suits over 2-day period to protect from bacteria, viruses, and other hazards while cleaning out a hoarders apartment that involved some very nasty stuff! The suits held up well against the bending, stooping, and abrasion of objects. I strongly recommend keeping extra on hand just in case of tearing. All suits eventually ripped, starting in the crotch area.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: Very good item and if you use them out side in the summer you will burn up.
customer_reviews.author: Big man

customer_reviews.title: At 6'1" with a 33" inseam, these (Large) were ...
customer_reviews.text: At 6'1" with a 33" inseam, these (Large) were a bit too short for me and tended to rip in the knee area any time I had to bend over or squat down to reach something. In the future I would purchase a suit without the feet and then buy the shoe covers separately. Otherwise they were as described and would have worked decently during popcorn ceiling removal and subsequent sanding and mudding processes.
customer_reviews.author: mclaugem

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty good for light use
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good for light use. Ive tried using them more than once. If your lucky you might get another use out of one. They keep you clothes clean when crawling around in crawlspaces, but they tear pretty easily. Water goes right through them. I would recommend them but don't plans on reusing them. Buy extras. More like painting coverall than construction coverall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Works well to keep you clean and dry. This product is thick enough that it does not tear easily.
customer_reviews.author: Product purchased

customer_reviews.title: Half the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great price and product. I'm 5'9 153lb and always order XL for the extra space and comfort. No tears after crawling around in 23" crawl space for a couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Great suits.
customer_reviews.text: I got these to upgrade from my TY120S...Everything is pretty awesome. Used my first one yesterday, normal use, and no rips. The elastic in the sleeves is perfect, and the hood seals really well, too. Even with a full face mask on, the zipper doesn't open, which has happened with every other hooded suit I've bought.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Pedreros

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again 👍
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size larger as influenced and it fit great. Worked really well too. Strong yet not so nice you avoid chucking it after a job. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Item did not include attached boots as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The product description is false advertising. It claims to have attached boots, but it does not. There is only an elastic band at the ankle, so I had to purchase foot covers from Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Long

customer_reviews.title: did the job for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: These worked well for our needs in a messy project in the crawlspace involving chemical sprays and insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Durable for what it is intended for
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to wear while removing some asbestos shingles from my house. They stood up to a full day's abuse of climbing up and down ladders, kneeling and crawling and just general use. Only issue I had was that it was a bit of a sauna wearing them as they held in all the moisture I generated while working in the 85 degree sun.
customer_reviews.author: Huckleberry

customer_reviews.title: Great for many uses!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great all-around purchase. Not only can you use an outfit for painting, but you can wear it while working in poison oak bushes! This Halloween, I painted some stripes on the arms and legs, and made a NASA logo to cover the DuPont Tyvek sign -- and Ta da! I had an astronaut costume! Beware that the material is not breathable, though. I found myself needing to cool my body down while in my costume.
customer_reviews.author: PAHOUA LEE

customer_reviews.title: It protects your clothes
customer_reviews.text: I am using it for a project. I needed something to over me from head to toe and it does.
customer_reviews.author: Karla P.

customer_reviews.title: Tyvek
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Very nice item to have working out doors
customer_reviews.author: Keep Smiling

customer_reviews.title: Advertised with foot covers/booties but did not
customer_reviews.text: The material was nice quality. Better than I thought. Was a little disappointed it did not come with the advertised foot covers.
customer_reviews.author: Caseydc

customer_reviews.title: these suits were fantastic while cleaning out an old house with tons of ...
customer_reviews.text: these suits were fantastic while cleaning out an old house with tons of questionable disgusting substances. just remember to also get a respirator to use along with this.
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the quality of these. Seems like I tackle a project every every year that is a lot less miserable with a good coverall. I would recommend these is you are looking for airtight and lightweight. Worked well for an insulation project for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Good suits. Don't rip easy which is nice. Wish they had built in booties.
customer_reviews.author: Stasia

customer_reviews.title: They work for me
customer_reviews.text: These work well and if you buy, order them one size larger than you think you'll need as they do run a bit small. I use them in my clean room for culturing gourmet mushrooms. The boots on the suit are good because most of bacteria is on shoes and comes from the floor.
customer_reviews.author: MrZ

customer_reviews.title: Quality Tyvek Coverall
customer_reviews.text: The fabric on this coverall was stronger than I expected. Ideal for protection when spraying. Belongs in any shelter. I have one in each vehicle, along with a slip-on boot. Suitable for repeat wear, since the fabric is durable. Works for painting.
customer_reviews.author: RetroReader

customer_reviews.title: Received wrong ones
customer_reviews.text: The ones we received did not have attached booties. Did not check box until it was too late for a return.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pfeffer

customer_reviews.title: The boots have me sold
customer_reviews.text: The boots are great! I use these when inspecting crawl spaces where the more coverage the better. I've never had a problem with durability. They provide the protection you expect.
customer_reviews.author: buyonline

customer_reviews.title: Zipper problem
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. But sometimes zippers are easy to broke.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: These are cool. I wanted protection in each of my vehicles ...
customer_reviews.text: These are cool. I wanted protection in each of my vehicles in case I have to do impromptu maintenance or run into other trouble on the road where something like this might save me from ruining my clothing. Also good for Halloween as a Spaceman or Abominable Snowman, or perhaps a Snow Ninja!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't do without these.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for wearing when doing poison ivy removal in my yard. Also great for cleaning out the basement and garage - keeps the debri and spiders off.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C.

customer_reviews.title: It's also cooler and fits better than some of the ones I've used in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted for crawling in the spaces under the house. Keeps the bugs from crawling into my clothes, and the dirt from my clothes. It's also cooler and fits better than some of the ones I've used in the past that tore easily, especially in the crotch area.
customer_reviews.author: L. A.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: not true to size, very hot, not breathable in any way
customer_reviews.author: Lynda J. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: use these for grinding brick for tuckpointing well made. i will buy more
customer_reviews.author: Tim Laurenzi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have more tieback for the last 15 years and see no reason to change
customer_reviews.author: MIKE DOWNS

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight protection from yucky stuff
customer_reviews.text: Used these for a horrible bed bug situation at my work. Really helped.
customer_reviews.author: RinnyC

customer_reviews.title: Item recieved was garbage
customer_reviews.text: I need a refund the item looked like garbage this company sells me garbage I am scared to use this product for fear of contracting Covid-19 it looked like they took this product out of a dumpster!
customer_reviews.author: lucretia casey

customer_reviews.title: Good suit
customer_reviews.text: Great durable suit for staining and lacquering. Price on amazon was way better than at local Sherwin Williams
customer_reviews.author: Jon Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but missing booties
customer_reviews.text: Minus 1 star because were no booties provided. Sizing was accurate, zipper in front works well. Can be reused if you're using for cosmetic mess containment.
customer_reviews.author: RequiredName

customer_reviews.title: I didn't die.
customer_reviews.text: Used this as part of a mold abatement. I didn't die, so I guess it means the suit did something right! Of note, I'm 6'3" tall, and the suit fit, but was a little tight. A couple of times I tore the boot section open and just duct taped my rubber boots to the suit to maintain containment
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: No Booties
customer_reviews.text: No booties. The suits were fine, did their job - mostly. I needed the boots on them. Please send the actual item you are selling.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5'7", 170 pound female and bought the large size. It's too tight in the hip area and ripped after about 30 minutes of use. You should definitely order BIG.
customer_reviews.author: Taramisu

customer_reviews.title: I'm 6'7 and other 2XL's fit fine.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2XL and is too short. I'm 6'7 and other 2XL's fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Tyvek the best. Forget the rest!
customer_reviews.text: It's Tyvek. The best for light right, breathable, and right size
customer_reviews.author: SDJ

customer_reviews.title: Review DuPont Tyvek Disposable Coverall w/Hood and Boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought for protection when pulling out poison ivy. Held up well. Definitely does not breathe, so something light that covers arms to elbows and legs to knees would not go amiss. Didn't need hood. Shoe covering was a too big, but held up against a cement drive and around the yard. At 5'7" and fluffy, coverall had plenty of room. Pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Becka

customer_reviews.title: Good outdoors
customer_reviews.text: these are a great value that I would gladly buy again. bying them in bulk is really helpful. I like to use them as rain gear when I go hiking in the mountains
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: They did not have boots. I could not return them because I needed them, so, we had to improvise.
customer_reviews.author: Artrain

customer_reviews.title: Good but buy one size up
customer_reviews.text: Standard coverall. Usually I am Small/Medium, but after putting on the Large I am happy with the extra room, and looser feeling without feeling like I am swimming in it.
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: Clean, Neat & Safe!
customer_reviews.text: A real time & energy saver! Keeps shoes clean right along with everything else. Eliminates gaps around shoes/boots and legs riding up. Head stays clean if needed as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Disposable coverals
customer_reviews.text: Light weigh, very much what they said they would be, but are hot to work in. Best if used on a lower temperature day, 60 to 70 degrees. Arrived within 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. McFadden

customer_reviews.title: Great for crawlspace adventures. Not waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Great for crawlspace adventures. But they aren't waterproof. I didn't expect them to be.
customer_reviews.author: L. P

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: these suits work for insulating I have a full face mask, nothing get in. will buy these again, ps love the booties. they don't last too long, but nice touch
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. Fit a little big but was secure
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a house demo involving a 1000 bat infestation. Worked great. Fit a little big but was secure. Was kind of warm but it seals. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: snow suit
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof snow suit, in a pinch. the knees will give out so try not to stress them more than you have to. for $10 theses are a steal!
customer_reviews.author: reluctant tech

customer_reviews.title: Sizing on this item is TOTALLY INACCURATE! I order ...
customer_reviews.text: Sizing on this item is TOTALLY INACCURATE! I order a box of size Extra Large for my yard guys to handle cacti with noxious plant sap. The Size Extra Large barely fits the small 130 pound man, and no way will it an average size man. VERY DISAPPOINTING!
customer_reviews.author: book lover

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful multi-suit box... works great
customer_reviews.text: I needed these for cleaning up a nasty area and it worked great. Just use and toss. The only issue would have been trying to figure out if I should keep my shoes on or take them off, as it was a little hard getting my foot (with shoes) in the boot section.
customer_reviews.author: Staley

customer_reviews.title: As described... really, what more can ...
customer_reviews.text: As described... really, what more can you say about a case of Tyvek? (okay... other than you get SIX for the price of one from a big box hardware store...)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They do what they say
customer_reviews.text: They work well they keep farm chemicals out when we are spraying
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Phulps

customer_reviews.title: Great Alarmist Purchase
customer_reviews.text: So hopefully this alarmist won't need these for horrible things other than crawling under the house to do repairs. I jumped on the band wagon. What can I say? -Nancy
customer_reviews.author: Ralin

customer_reviews.title: Multi use product. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Great item for personal protection. We used these while doing yard work to help keep the insects and allergens from contacting our skin. Nice produce at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: President & CEO

customer_reviews.title: Great for the job.
customer_reviews.text: Did some heavy "dirty" cleaning job in the basement and felt this protected me and all my helpers without any complaints about their clothes getting soiled. Did the job.
customer_reviews.author: fishtail

customer_reviews.title: As described... really, what more can ...
customer_reviews.text: As described... really, what more can you say about a case of Tyvek? (okay... other than you get SIX for the price of one from a big box hardware store...)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are durable and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! The DuPont Tyvek disposable coveralls were used for protection to crawl underneath homes for inspection.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Silva

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful. Cheap enough that I use them around the ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely useful. Cheap enough that I use them around the house when doing messy clean up jobs -- not just for toxic waste!
customer_reviews.author: CAAmazoner

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this product many times, perfectly fit and exactly matched the product description!
customer_reviews.author: Bigfoot

customer_reviews.title: Great product, price, delivery
customer_reviews.text: Product exactly as described at a great price. Delivered ahead of promised date. DuPont has offered these coveralls for a long time and set the industry standard.
customer_reviews.author: Woody in Aiken SC

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Get 2XLg if you wear womans 12 and up...or else it will be snug. But it does protect when cleaning or spraying house...
customer_reviews.author: S. Martino

customer_reviews.title: Great Suite, Just What We Needed.
customer_reviews.text: The suites came as expected and are what I needed. I was impressed with the quality of the suites.
customer_reviews.author: Middleman

customer_reviews.title: pretty comfortable. Worked around lots of nails and screws ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, pretty comfortable. Worked around lots of nails and screws and the suits held up really well. Only a few punctures here and there.
customer_reviews.author: Darkprince

customer_reviews.title: Tough, even working in buggy forest, and it doesn't rip easily.
customer_reviews.text: I don't throw it away after each use, as is suggested. They are pretty tough, so I re-use.
customer_reviews.author: zoop

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, used them to protect me while taking the ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, used them to protect me while taking the weedeater to our archery range that has patches of poison ivy. First summer I've gone without getting it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Used when insulating attic. much better quality than local lumber uard
customer_reviews.author: gth

customer_reviews.title: They do the job!
customer_reviews.text: They do the job. No quality issues and fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: i use these when turning pens on my lathe. It keeps the shavings out of my collar!
customer_reviews.author: Sgt Slawter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The item was exactly as it was described and shipping was fast.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Use these when we have to spray the trees, very good
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen K.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't have everything that it says
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with attached hood and boots and no elastic cuffs. I guess they overcharge me for items that didn't come with it,
customer_reviews.author: mark lavoie

customer_reviews.title: A headlamp keeps the hood snug
customer_reviews.text: Great for keeping the dirt, insulation and critters away from clothing and skin when working in attics and crawlspaces. Low friction when trying to slither across the vapor barrier in tight crawlspaces. A headlamp keeps the hood snug against the safety glasses/head for maintain good field of vision. Size 11 work boots fit snuggly in the XL size booties. They are light weight and store in very little space. I keep one in my personal cars – they are nice to have protect you suit or street clothes if you have a flat tire, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Suit was fine but wished the other items were included in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 6 pack and only received the suit, no hoods, no booties and no gloves. Suit was fine but wished the other items were included in the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: CNun

product_meta.title: DuPont Tyvek 400 TY122S Disposable Protective Coverall with Elastic Cuffs, Attached Hood and Boots, White, X-Large (Pack of 6)
product_meta.description:
The DuPont Tyvek TY122S hooded coverall features an attached respirator-fit hood with elastic around face opening designed to cover neck and chin and fit around respirator face mask. Longer zipper extends to chin for complete coverage of neck area. Elastic opening for tighter fit at wrist. Attached Tyvek FC boots have special coating to provide added skid-resistance. Comfort fit design based on extensive wearer input to provide our most comfortable garment design that: enables a greater range of movement while stretching and bending, provides a more tailored fit, offers reinforcement in high stress areas for fewer blowouts, utilizes a longer zipper for easier donning and doffing and an elastic waist to better position the garment. Tyvek garments are composed of flash spun high density polyethylene which creates a unique, nonwoven material available only from DuPont Tyvek. Tyvek provides an ideal balance of protection, durability and comfort of any limited use fabric technology. Tyvek fabric offers an inherent barrier to particles down to 1 micron in size. Protection is built into the fabric itself; there are no films or laminates to abrade or wear away. Tyvek fabric's durability advantage over microporous film and SMS fabrics delivers consistently better barrier, even after wear and abrasion. Applications include: lead and asbestos abatement/remediation, general maintenance/operations, spray painting, general clean-up. Serged seams. X-Large size. Available in white color.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Different jobs require different levels of protective equipment and clothing. DuPont Personal Protection offers a wide range of protective clothing and accessories to meet those varying needs.
feature_bullets: Comfort fit design based on extensive wearer input to provide our most comfortable garment design that: enables a greater range of movement while stretching and bending, provides a more tailored fit, offers reinforcement in high stress areas for fewer blowouts, utilizes a longer zipper for easier donning and doffing and an elastic waist to better position the garment
Attached respirator-fit hood with elastic around face opening, designed to cover neck and chin and fit around respirator face mask
Longer zipper extends to chin for complete coverage of neck area
Elastic opening for tighter fit at wrist
Attached Tyvek FC boots have special coating to provide added skid-resistance
Tyvek 400 fabric's durability advantage over microporous film fabrics delivers consistently better barrier, even after wear and abrasion.
